Installation Guide¶

Before beginning, make sure you have Python3 installed.

  1. First, download the repository and place it in its own folder.
  2. Next, if you don’t have it installed, install virtualenv with:
sudo pip install virtualenv
  1. In the directory above the repository, enter:
virtualenv venv -p python3

This will create a Python3 virtual environment.

  1. To activate the virtual environment, enter:
source venv/bin/activate

You can leave the virtual environment at any time with:

deactivate
  1. Next, move down into the folder with the repo’s files in it and enter:
pip install -r requirements.txt

to install all of the necessary Python packages. If necessary, run:

sudo pip install -r requirements.txt
  1. To set up the (development) database, enter:
python3 manage.py makemigrations
python3 manage.py migrate
  1. If you want to create a superuser account for yourself in the database, enter:
python3 manage.py createsuperuser
  1. To run the website on localhost, at any time enter:
python3 manage.py runserver
  1. To set up Selenium for acceptance testing, go to http://docs.seleniumhq.org/download/ and download Selenium IDE 2.9.0 for Firefox.

That’s all! You’re ready to go.
